result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Thomas Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Thomas Ross is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Thomas Ross was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell signed Order December 10, 2015 - amend credit.


-To run Concurrent with St. Croix County Case #13CF13.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant remanded into custody of St. Croix County Sheriff.
-Credit for time served to be determined.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 13CF13

superMiscConds.notes: $268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF26.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka, DF:  Michael Thomas Ross appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:06 a.m.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Crt uses the testimony of Investigator Mikla from the preliminary hearing.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & Ct. 3. Sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 3 years to run concurrent with 13CF13
- 1 I/C
- 2 years E/S 
- Credit for time served to be determined
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Remanded to the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department for transportation to Dodge
- Ct. 1 court costs $268.00 to be paid through the DOC (Probation)
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by Atty Repka. Requesting a continuance of 10/8/0/2015 Plea. Hearing reset. km

Plea hearing at 10-08-2015 01:00 pm
Plea hearing at 10-08-2015 09:00 am
Plea hearing at 10-08-2015 09:00 am

Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:45 a.m. lw
